posts.title: Barbie dreams
posts.content:
✨ Barbie Dreams: More Than Just Plastic

Growing up, Barbie wasn’t just a doll — she was a whole world. From astronaut to vet to popstar, she made it feel like anything was possible. I’d line them up on my pink carpet, each one with a different story, a different dream. And in between brushing their hair and switching outfits, I was building the confidence to imagine my own dreams, too.

As I got older, I realized Barbie was more than just fun — she was kind of iconic. Sure, she’s been criticized, but she’s also evolved. Now she comes in all shapes, skin tones, and styles, showing that “Barbie” isn’t a one-size-fits-all fantasy. That shift? It matters. Because representation in even the smallest things — like toys — has power.

Today, I look back at those Barbie dreams with a soft smile. They were playful and bold, a little sparkly and a little wild. But most importantly, they were mine. And maybe that’s what Barbie really gave us — permission to imagine, reimagine, and always dream a little bigger.
posts.author: nicki

posts.title: Solar Eclipse
posts.content:
There’s something truly breathtaking about watching the moon slowly glide in front of the sun, casting a shadow over the Earth — it’s a solar eclipse, a rare cosmic performance that reminds us just how vast and mysterious the universe is. For a few moments, the day turns to twilight, temperatures drop, and the world falls quiet, all as the moon blocks the sun's powerful rays.

Solar eclipses don’t happen every day. They occur only when the moon is perfectly aligned between the Earth and the sun — during a new moon phase. Depending on where you are, you might witness a total, partial, or annular eclipse. Each type brings its own kind of wonder, with the total eclipse being the most dramatic: the sky goes dark, stars may appear, and the sun’s corona — its glowing outer atmosphere — becomes visible.

For many, experiencing a solar eclipse is a once-in-a-lifetime event. Whether you're a sky-gazer, science lover, or just someone who enjoys nature’s beauty, a solar eclipse is a powerful reminder of how small we are — and how amazing our universe truly is. Just don’t forget your eclipse glasses! 😎🌘
